DOC.brief_summary: AIMS To determine effect high low sucrose diet liver fat healthy adult men liver fat level 5 % DESIGN Randomized , cross-over design two 7-day dietary intervention separate 4 week wash-out period . Dietary intervention base iso-energetic substitution sucrose starch weight-maintaining diet . The two experimental condition : high sucrose diet 25 % total energy intake ( approximately 95th percentile UK intake non-milk extrinsic sugar ( NMES ) ) ; low sucrose diet 10 % total energy intake . Otherwise macronutrient balance condition base UK average habitual intake . POPULATION 10 healthy male age 20 40 year , BMI 20-25kg/m2 , normal liver fat level ( < 5 % ) fasting plasma glucose evidence insulin resistance recruit . No pre-existing morbidity include cardiac , hepatic renal disease , history diabetes , hypertension hyperlipidemia . Usual physical activity subject range sedentary maximum meeting UK minimum activity recommendation ( 30 min moderate exercise 5 d/week ) . Habitual alcohol intake less 2 unit per day . TREATMENT Pre-intervention : Participants ask record habitual dietary intake completion 7-day food diary ask wear accelerometer armband assess physical activity intervention week . Resting energy expenditure also assess indirect calorimetry . 7 day dietary intervention : Participants resident clinical research facility Hammersmith Hospital intervention week 5 7 day food provide facility . At weekend , participant leave unit food provide two day diet continue home . At start end 7 day intervention : Weight , height waist circumference take ; percentage liver fat total regional body composition measure MRI . Fasting post prandial plasma glucose , insulin lipid measure blood pressure .
